content: Investments Blue Chips OCBC FRANK Card Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 18 May 2019OCBC Frank allows $100 investment a month for bluechip through them but there is a monthly fee of $5 . If i invest $100/month, I will make a lost by the end of the year. Is this common? Should I put in more going forward if not what should I do?2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Tan Wei MingLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 07 Jun 2019OCBC Monthly Investment plan is too expensive for someone who wants to invest $100 a month. $5 out of $100 is alr 5% cost. That's too expensive! Besides POSB InvestSaver, the other monthly investment plan that I will recommend is Maybank Kim Eng monthly investment plan. Do take a look!2 comments1

Guo Hao Teo18 May 2019Yeah agreed donâ€™t invest only $100 to start with. You are already net 5% down when you begin on the OCBC BCIPYCYewFong Chua18 May 2019I remember the amount that I started was $500 per month and I recall OCBC only charge me the first $5 transaction only. Subsequently, I was not charge for the $5.

I guess only when you stop and sell away your share. The new charges will apply again. Do check with individual bank to understand better.

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 May 2019If you want to invest in the STI ETF of $100 a month, it might be better to use POSB Invest Saver or Maybank Kim Eng monthly investment plan. https://blog.seedly.sg/which-regular-savings-plan-is-the-cheapest/0 comments0
